author: Rumi
quote: You are not just the drop in the ocean, but the entire ocean in each drop.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: The sage does not attempt anything very big, and thus achieves greatness.

author: Zen Proverb
quote: You are perfect as you are, and you could use a little improvement.

author: Eckhart Tolle
quote: The present moment is the only time over which we have dominion.

author: Alan Watts
quote: The meaning of life is just to be alive. It is so plain and so obvious and so simple.

author: Buddha
quote: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
quote: Walk as if you are kissing the Earth with your feet.

author: Chuang Tzu
quote: The perfect man uses his mind like a mirror - grasping nothing, refusing nothing.

author: Rumi
quote: Yesterday I was clever, so I wanted to change the world. Today I am wise, so I am changing myself.

author: Zen Master Huang Po
quote: Your everyday mind - that is the Way!

author: Osho
quote: Experience life in all possible ways - good-bad, bitter-sweet, dark-light, summer-winter. Experience all the dualities.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: At the center of your being you have the answer; you know who you are and you know what you want.

author: Dogen
quote: To study the Buddha Way is to study the self. To study the self is to forget the self.

author: Pema Chödrön
quote: Nothing ever goes away until it has taught us what we need to know.

author: Ramana Maharshi
quote: Your own Self-realization is the greatest service you can render the world.

author: Zen Saying
quote: Before enlightenment, chop wood, carry water. After enlightenment, chop wood, carry water.

author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
quote: Truth is a pathless land.

author: Mooji
quote: Don't worry about enlightenment. Sit down wherever you are and listen to the wind singing in your veins.

author: Hafez
quote: I wish I could show you, when you are lonely or in darkness, the astonishing light of your own being.

author: Basho
quote: Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the wise. Seek what they sought.

author: Terry Pratchett
quote: The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it.

author: Douglas Adams
quote: I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: I can resist everything except temptation.

author: Groucho Marx
quote: I don't want to belong to any club that would accept me as one of its members.

author: Steven Wright
quote: I haven't slept for ten days, because that would be too long.

author: Ambrose Bierce
quote: War is God's way of teaching Americans geography.

author: Mark Twain
quote: The reports of my death have been greatly exaggerated.

author: Voltaire
quote: Common sense is not so common.

author: George Carlin
quote: Think of how stupid the average person is, and realize half of them are stupider than that.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: I am prepared to meet my Maker. Whether my Maker is prepared for the great ordeal of meeting me is another matter entirely.

author: Dorothy Parker
quote: I'd rather have a bottle in front of me than a frontal lobotomy.

author: Woody Allen
quote: I'm not afraid to die. I just don't want to be there when it happens.

author: Mae West
quote: I generally avoid temptation unless I can't resist it.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quote: Beer is proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy.

author: Yogi Berra
quote: Nobody goes there anymore. It's too crowded.

author: Unknown
quote: The early bird might get the worm, but the second mouse gets the cheese.

author: Robert Frost
quote: A bank is a place where they lend you an umbrella in fair weather and ask for it back when it begins to rain.

author: Unknown
quote: If you think nobody cares if you're alive, try missing a couple of car payments.

author: Unknown
quote: The road to success is always under construction.

author: Unknown
quote: Time flies like an arrow; fruit flies like a banana.
